newsitem.title: USA: Cortex begins enrollment for trials.
newsitem.headline: Cortex begins enrollment for trials.

text.p: Cortex Pharmaceuticals Inc said it has started patient enrollment in a Phase I/IIa clinical trial of its CX516, or Ampalex, compound in patients with Alzheimer's disease.
The trials will be conducted in collaboration with the National Institutes of Health in Bethesda, Maryland.

Cortex said it had previously demonstrated that single oral administrations of Ampalex are safe and well tolerated by healthy young and elderly volunteers, and appear to produce positive effects on simple memory functions.
It said the purpose of the upcoming study will be to demonstrate the safety and tolerability of multiple administrations of Amaplex in patients with Alzheimer's.
